articles.title: A 'very special' FA Cup win and why managing Ronaldo is 'easy'
articles.summary: Portugal manager Roberto Martinez sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his life in football.

articles.title: Ferguson 'giving Hearts pointers' on Scottish title fight
articles.summary: Hearts head coach Derek McInnes says he's in regular contact with Sir Alex Ferguson as the league leaders prepare to take on Rangers at Ibrox in a crunch match this weekend.

articles.title: Man City thrash Leicester to move 11 points clear in WSL
articles.summary: Manchester City regain their 11-point lead at the top of the Women's Super League as they thrash Leicester City at the Joie Stadium.

articles.title: Smith & Terland feature in UWCL best goals
articles.summary: Arsenal's Olivia Smith and Manchester United's Elisabeth Terland feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League play-offs.

articles.title: Netball Super League squad signings and departures ahead of the 2026 season
articles.summary: The first season of the rejuvenated Netball Super League saw a big shake up as the league went from 12 teams to just eight, and the super shot was introduced.

articles.title: Neto scores hat-trick as Chelsea see off Hull in FA Cup
articles.summary: A Pedro Neto hat-trick fires Chelsea through to the FA Cup fifth round with a comfortable win at Championship Hull City.

articles.title: Discriminatory chants called 'stain on game' after arrests made at Hull City
articles.summary: Arrests have been made following incidents of alleged discriminatory chanting during the FA Cup fourth round match between Hull City and Chelsea.

articles.title: One manager, two jobs - how will O'Neill's situation work?
articles.summary: After the announcement that he will manage both Northern Ireland and Blackburn Rovers this season, how will Michael O'Neill juggle two jobs?

articles.title: 'We have a lot of work to do' - Guardiola on Ratcliffe's comments
articles.summary: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says we will "have a better society" by embracing other cultures but the world has "a lot of work to do".

articles.title: Pereira signs deal as Forest boss until end of next season
articles.summary: Vitor Pereira has signed a deal until the end of next season to become Nottingham Forest's fourth manager of the campaign.

articles.title: Africa Cup of Nations 2027 set for June-July slot
articles.summary: Afcon 2027 will be held in June and July next year and reports the finals could be delayed are "totally unfounded", says African football boss Patrice Motsepe.

articles.title: 'I had to put everyone on edge' - how managers make an impact
articles.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains the key things a manager can do before, during and after matches to get the results they want.

articles.title: Man City's Rodri charged over 'not fair' referee comments
articles.summary: Manchester City midfielder Rodri is charged with misconduct by the Football Association following comments he made about referees following his side's 2-2 draw with Tottenham earlier this month.

articles.title: Rangers v Hearts, Oxlade-Chamberlain and Goodwin in focus
articles.summary: Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts travel to Ibrox in the game of the weekend, while Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Jim Goodwin are also in focus

articles.title: Better society if we 'embrace other cultures' - Guardiola
articles.summary: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says we will "have a better society" by embracing other cultures, in response to Sir Jim Ratcliffe's immigration remarks.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Wrexham beat Ipswich to progress to FA Cup fifth round
articles.summary: Wrexham book their place in the fifth round of the FA Cup for the first time in 29 years as they beat Championship rivals Ipswich Town at Stok Cae Ras.

articles.title: Watch: Paton lob seals St Johnstone win at Airdrie
articles.summary: Watch Ruari Paton's solitary goal in St Johnstone's win at Airdrieonians, which moved the Perth side five points clear at the top of the Scottish Championship.

articles.title: Leigh Leopards 26-14 Leeds Rhinos
articles.summary: Highlights of the Betfred Super League match between Leigh Leopards and Leeds Rhinos.
